item.title: Presidential Fundraising
item.description:
During June, Republican presidential candidate John McCain raised $22 million, while Democratic presidential candidate Barack Obama raised $52 million. Not surprisingly, their letters to potential contributors were quite different.

More commentary from John Carroll

Support WGBH
item.itunes:author: WGBH Educational Foundation
item.itunes:subtitle: Award-winning journalist and public radio veteran John Carroll gives his perspective on today's hottest topics.

item.title: Lefthanders
item.description: WGBH commentator John Carroll's take on left-handed politicking. As the 2008 presidential race heats up, political coverage routinely employs the time-honored on-the-one-hand, on-the-other-hand approach. And all that talk about the other hand could get a fellow to thinking about... lefthanders.
